data.title: Very Interesting Place
data.text:
Unique food and decorating style.  Everything tasted great.

The owners took us a tour of the place.  Can't wait to see what they do with the building.

data.title: Quirky but delicious
data.text: This place has a little bit of an identity crisis as it is a nightclub, but also a bar restaurant. We were interested in the latter, and it delivered. We went for dinner around 7pm on a Saturday and snagged the last couple seats at the bar, which was good because sitting at the tables looked kind of awkward. Everyone was friendly and chatting with each other and the bartender. The menu is kind of limited, but we had delicious brussel sprouts and some good wontons. They had other eclectic bar snacks and few other items. Very good beer selection.

data.title: Fun, cool, great drinks and food
data.text: We love this location, remodeled old building with a great history.  Drinks are great always a special that is good, some great beers on tap.  The food is interesting and delicious.  Love the fried brussel sprouts and Mediterranean pizza but all we tried so far is good.  Lots of different types of music.  We heard some great music ad had fun dancing til the early morning!

data.title: Check this out on your next trip to Dubuque
data.text: Are you wanting to experience a unique night out? The Smokestack in Dubuque is a one of a kind destination for great food and cocktails, and chances are you'll find the regular entertainment to be top notch. Susan and Scott are your hosts and they make certain that everyone has a good time. The old architecture of the building, which originally was a hotel, then a creamery, is unique and rustic. You'll be glad you made the stop here!

data.title: yes there is a big smolestack
data.text: just kind of a strange space thats kind of 60s in dbq.  heard bartenders are not good at events and reminds me of famous artist bar where you left the peanut shells on floor as part of the decor

owner_response.author: smokestackdbq, Owner at The Smokestack, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for your feedback. I'm sorry our venue was not what you expected on your visit. We're always learning, so we hope you'll give us another chance.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun, nice decor and lots more.
data.text: Dropped in one late afternoon for the first time.  Pleasantly surprised with the feeling you get when entering and afterwards. Brick wall scene.  Nice, very small bar.  Great craft cocktails mixed, stirred, shaken right in front of you. The menu is not extensive but great bar food.  Great. Huge plates of fries. Rangoon, cheese plate, sandwiches, salads,all look great and flatbreads.are great. Also, music, art, live presentations and colorful clients.

data.title: Very unique bar
data.text: old style chairs and couches with live music and an old factory feel this place has some custom drinks that are not foo foo drinks, be ready for some alcohol. We did not have the food but did snack on some bar nuts if that counts.  Bar nuts were fresh and served in a bowl. It was a fun bar that has some great music on the weekends

data.title: Interesting
data.text: Fun small menu. Owners are super kind and friendly. The place has a fun feel and a great bar. Give it a try.
